basics.name: Codie Freeman
basics.label: Analytical Chemist | Pharmaceutical Chemistry Student | Computational Methods (Developing)
basics.summary: GMP-trained analytical chemist and Pharmaceutical Chemistry student with experience in solid-state characterisation, physicochemical data generation, and regulated laboratory environments. Strong understanding of data integrity (ALCOA++), regulatory compliance, and scientific documentation. Actively developing computational and data-driven approaches to chemical sciences alongside industrial experience.

work.name: Resolian UK
work.summary: Industrial placement within a GMP-compliant analytical laboratory supporting R&D and regulated client projects.
highlights: Designed and executed an iGC-SEA case study achieving up to 50% run-time reduction across multiple APIs, producing an internal technical report to support method development.
Optimised light microscopy workflows by replacing a multi-step manual composition process with a built-in tool, reducing analysis time and improving consistency.
Generated and reviewed physicochemical datasets for R&D and GMP projects, contributing to 5+ sponsor reports with complete audit trails and compliant documentation.
Developed training resources and delivered technical training to analysts, with materials adopted across the wider laboratory.

work.name: JD Wetherspoon
work.summary: Operational and people leadership role within a highly regulated, high-throughput hospitality environment.
highlights: Managed and trained a 90+ person team, improving internal audit scores by 15% through strengthened SOP adherence and onboarding processes.
Led a regulatory inspection achieving a 5/5 compliance rating through effective documentation control and staff readiness.
Oversaw rota planning, compliance, training, and day-to-day operations within a multi-million-pound turnover site.

education.summary: Degree programme including a foundation year, approved interruption of study, and an industrial placement year.
courses: AI and Machine Learning for Chemical Sciences

projects.name: Pharmaceutical Practical Project
projects.description: Experimental analytical chemistry project focused on drug quantification and method validation.
highlights: Quantified antiretroviral drugs in simulated bodily fluids using HPLC-MS, generating calibration curves (1–100 µg mL⁻¹, R² > 0.995).
Performed method validation including residual error analysis, LOD/LOQ determination, and calibration checks, identifying sources of inaccuracy and variability.

projects.name: Surface Energy Characterisation (Independent Project)
projects.description: Independent solid-state characterisation project conducted during industrial placement.
highlights: Applied iGC-SEA to investigate surface energy profiles of pharmaceutical solids.
Developing a reproducible workflow with the aim of poster presentation at an external scientific meeting.

projects.name: Computational & Data Science Development
projects.description: Ongoing self-directed development of computational skills for chemical sciences.
highlights: Working through Python for Chemistry coursework with documented notebooks hosted on GitHub.
Developing data parsing and analysis tools for iGC datasets, with plans for an open-source toolkit.
Building foundational knowledge in machine learning with the aim of future application to chemical data.

volunteer.summary: Deliver outreach through the 'I’m a Scientist' programme, supporting engagement in chemistry and pharmaceutical sciences.
